what: Hypothesis Tests Using Biased and Unbiased Urn Models Inspired by Muriel Bristol and Ronald Fisher
title: Hypothesis Tests Using Biased and Unbiased Urn Models Inspired by Muriel Bristol and Ronald Fisher
text: set functions compute pp-values perform sensitivity analysis, adapting Fisher’s pp-value test case studies process tracing. uses unbiased biased urn models draw null distributions absence randomization.

title: Hypothesis Tests Using Biased and Unbiased Urn Models Inspired by Muriel Bristol and Ronald Fisher
text: name package Dr. Murial Bristol, better known “tea lady” Fisher’s pp-value demonstration. Fewer people aware “lady” fellow researcher Rothamsted Research institute. Beyond brilliant scientist , Dr. Bristol indeed taste whether tea milk poured first cup, evidence suggests.

what: Find a p-value given a certain number of observations in favor of the working hypothesis among a total number of observations when there are two types of observations — find_p_two_types
title: Find a p-value given a certain number of observations in favor of the working hypothesis among a total number of observations when there are two types of observations — find_p_two_types
text: observation can either support working theory rival theory, function returns p-value summarizing evidence rival theory provided working theory.

title: Find a p-value given a certain number of observations in favor of the working hypothesis among a total number of observations when there are two types of observations — find_p_two_types
code: find_p_two_types(   obs_support,   total_obs,   odds = 1,   weights = NULL,   interpretation = FALSE )

title: Find a p-value given a certain number of observations in favor of the working hypothesis among a total number of observations when there are two types of observations — find_p_two_types
text: obs_support integer representing number observations favor working hypothesis. Must less equal total. total_obs integer representing total number observations made odds odds observing rival versus working-theory observation. can interpreted "bias" observation. "relative ease" observation. weights Double. Default equal weight observation weights=NULL rep(1,obs_support). indicate one observation twice weight one might use rep(c(2,1),c(1,obs_support-1)) interpretation Logical. TRUE function returns text helping interpret result, FALSE (default option) returns p-value

title: Find a p-value given a certain number of observations in favor of the working hypothesis among a total number of observations when there are two types of observations — find_p_two_types
text: Either p-value (numeric, scalar) list containing p-value text containing interpretation

title: Find a p-value given a certain number of observations in favor of the working hypothesis among a total number of observations when there are two types of observations — find_p_two_types
text: function accomodates urns working theory supporting observations systematically easier difficulty observe rival supporting observations (odds). currently also supports designs one observation total supporting working theory  particularly compelling ("smoking gun"). example, observation 1 worth 2 observations, urn can reflect increasing number observations supporting rival theory urn, accounting weight smoking gun observation.

title: Find a p-value given a certain number of observations in favor of the working hypothesis among a total number of observations when there are two types of observations — find_p_two_types
code: # Equal probability, 2 kinds of evidence find_p_two_types(obs_support = 7, total_obs = 10) #> [1] 0.01864802 # Equal probability, 2 kinds of evidence with interpretation printed find_p_two_types(obs_support = 7, total_obs = 10, interpretation = TRUE) #> The maximum probability of drawing 7 observations which support the working theory from an urn model supporting a rival theory, where the odds of observing working theory information is odds=1 and evidentiary weights are (1,1,1,1,1,1,1), is p <=0.0186. #> $thep #> [1] 0.01864802 #>  #> $interp #> [1] "The maximum probability of drawing 7 observations which support the working theory from an urn model supporting a rival theory, where the odds of observing working theory information is odds=1 and evidentiary weights are (1,1,1,1,1,1,1), is p <=0.0186." #>  # Unequal probability, 2 kinds of evidence with interpretation printed find_p_two_types(obs_support = 7, total_obs = 10, interpretation = TRUE, odds = .5) #> The maximum probability of drawing 7 observations which support the working theory from an urn model supporting a rival theory, where the odds of observing working theory information is odds=0.5 and evidentiary weights are (1,1,1,1,1,1,1), is p <=0.003. #> $thep #> [1] 0.002989537 #>  #> $interp #> [1] "The maximum probability of drawing 7 observations which support the working theory from an urn model supporting a rival theory, where the odds of observing working theory information is odds=0.5 and evidentiary weights are (1,1,1,1,1,1,1), is p <=0.003." #>  find_p_two_types(obs_support = 7, total_obs = 10, interpretation = TRUE, odds = 2) #> The maximum probability of drawing 7 observations which support the working theory from an urn model supporting a rival theory, where the odds of observing working theory information is odds=2 and evidentiary weights are (1,1,1,1,1,1,1), is p <=0.0761. #> $thep #> [1] 0.07612251 #>  #> $interp #> [1] "The maximum probability of drawing 7 observations which support the working theory from an urn model supporting a rival theory, where the odds of observing working theory information is odds=2 and evidentiary weights are (1,1,1,1,1,1,1), is p <=0.0761." #>  # Equal probability, Unequal evidentiary weight, 2 kinds of evidence find_p_two_types(   obs_support = 7, total_obs = 10, weights = rep(1, 7),   interpretation = TRUE, odds = 1 ) #> The maximum probability of drawing 7 observations which support the working theory from an urn model supporting a rival theory, where the odds of observing working theory information is odds=1 and evidentiary weights are (1,1,1,1,1,1,1), is p <=0.0186. #> $thep #> [1] 0.01864802 #>  #> $interp #> [1] "The maximum probability of drawing 7 observations which support the working theory from an urn model supporting a rival theory, where the odds of observing working theory information is odds=1 and evidentiary weights are (1,1,1,1,1,1,1), is p <=0.0186." #>  find_p_two_types(   obs_support = 7, total_obs = 10,   weights = rep(c(2, 1), c(1, 7 - 1)), interpretation = TRUE, odds = 1 ) #> The maximum probability of drawing 7 observations which support the working theory from an urn model supporting a rival theory, where the odds of observing working theory information is odds=1 and evidentiary weights are (2,1,1,1,1,1,1), is p <=0.0105. #> $thep #> [1] 0.01048951 #>  #> $interp #> [1] "The maximum probability of drawing 7 observations which support the working theory from an urn model supporting a rival theory, where the odds of observing working theory information is odds=1 and evidentiary weights are (2,1,1,1,1,1,1), is p <=0.0105." #>

what: Sensitivity analysis for urn models with two types of information — sens_urn
title: Sensitivity analysis for urn models with two types of information — sens_urn
text: function allows researcher calculate odds drawing working theory supporting observation rival theory supporting observation required increase p-value certain value.

title: Sensitivity analysis for urn models with two types of information — sens_urn
Sensitivity analysis for urn models with two types of information — sens_urn
text: obs_support integer representing number observations favor working hypothesis. Must less equal total. total_obs integer representing total number observations weights vector numeric weights representing differential evidentiary weight working theory supporting observations. p_threshold decimal (Double). p-value threshold. Default p=.05.

title: Sensitivity analysis for urn models with two types of information — sens_urn
text: list two elements: (1) w differential odds observing working theory supporting observation rival theory supporting observation. (2) p p-value given found w.

title: Sensitivity analysis for urn models with two types of information — sens_urn
code: # What is the odds that would bring our p=.02 to p \approx .05 find_p_two_types(obs_support = 7, total_obs = 10, odds = 1) #> [1] 0.01864802 sens_urn(obs_support = 7, total_obs = 10, p_threshold = .05)$w #> [1] 1.58928 # Notice that this is correct: find_p_two_types(obs_support = 7, total_obs = 10, odds = 1.58928) #> [1] 0.04999995
